title: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. The design of the oblong with the ruined painting is similar to that of -1538. It is framed by ramifications of a band, framing alos the oblong panels with plants forming the central motifs in the lower section. An octagonal painting is suggested for its center; square paintings flanked by groups of children in conchiae, and parts of coffered vaults for the lateral parts.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration". Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1526.
